title: Coast Guard arrests 22 ‘smugglers’ in Cox’s Bazar
body: The Bangladesh Coast Guard arrested 22 smugglers in two separate operations at St Martins Island in Cox’s Bazar on Thursday night. The Coast Guard ship Apurba Bangla conducted an operation in the sea area southwest of St Martins Island and searched a suspicious fishing boat and arrested 11 Bangladeshi smugglers with 700 bags of cement, which were being smuggled to Myanmar by evading customs and taxes, said a press release. On the same day, the same ship also searched another suspicious fishing boat in the sea area of St Martins Island and arrested 11 Myanmar smugglers, including 1,200 pieces of Burmese lungis, while were illegally smuggling from Myanmar to Bangladesh by evading customs and taxes. Further legal action against the seized goods, the boat used in the smuggling operation, and the detained individuals is under process. The Coast Guard will continue such operations in the future to prevent smuggling.
